column1: The First Order General has a lot of detail for only 4.00.

column2: The First Order General comes in a polybag and has no instructions. The bag only shows the general and thats&nbsp
There are 4 parts to the set with the pants, body, head, and hat. The only unique piece is the generals hat with a unique look to it and has some very good detail on it.&nbsp

The First Order General has a lot of detail on him which is very nice to get in a minifigure from a polybag. He has normal black pants but his body is very good with his rank printed on his right arm. The face looks older than what the bags shows which surprised me right away but was nice since most officers in the Empire and First Order are older or look older. The First Order General does not come with a weapon which is the only negative thing I have about this polybag.
I don'
column3: t really think I have to say anything since all you build is just a minifigure.&nbsp

column2: Not really much I can say here to execpt that I was surprised by how much older they made the general look and how much detail they put into him as well.

Overall this was great to be able to get for just 4 dollars. The amount of detail on him was very nice from the rank on his arm to the detail to his face and even the hat he wears was very nice with the detail and look it had. Overall I would give this a 5 star rating.

column1: A polybag without instructions, nothing specific to add.
Simple minifig without anything special, which explains the rating.

The First Order General is a well-designed minifig, especially the hat, and the torso with a nicely printed detail on the left arm. However, the lack of detail to the legs is a minor con, according to me, and lowers the excitement of the exclusiveness of the figure.

column2: s identity increases its usefulness in different MOCs since the context in which he is presented is irrelevant, if you would want it to be displayed according to the film(s). A major pro of the set.

column1: Since its retail price was, as I understood it, free, getting the set
column2: when it was available in store was of course worth it. Even buying it on the after-market, which I did, is worth it if you appreciate the exclusiveness of these kinds of sets.&nbsp

column1: Overall a decent minifig polybag set, but nothing special. If you feel that there is one for a reasonably low price he is a nice addition to your collection.
